content: watsonx.governance” on page 64 and again in 6.4.2, “Considerations for lifecycle governance for traditional ML hosted on watsonx.ai” on page 70, a variety of metrics are available for configuration through watsonx.governance. When considering a model monitor in the operation stage, these metrics can be configured using the watsonx.governance UI or using notebooks. Review and follow the notebooks and directions provided in section 6.4.2, “Considerations for lifecycle governance for traditional ML hosted on watsonx.ai” on page 70 to establish baseline data configurations and respective monitors. Additionally, code commands also exist to directly move assets into the production (operation) stage. Here is a snippet on how to move a model into a production deployment space to see the lifecycle stage progress into operation stage: model.set_environment_type(from_container="validate", to_container="production") watsonx.governance comes with an expansive toolkit for handling the lifecycle of
